description: Coefficients in 1/(1+P(x)), where P(x) is the generating function of the primes.
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Backhouse's Constant
formula: Apply inverse of "INVERT" transform to primes: INVERT: a's from b's in 1+Sum a_i x^i = 1/(1-Sum b_i x^i).a(n) = -prime(n) - Sum_{i=1..n-1} prime(i)*a(n-i), for n > 0. - _Derek Orr_, Apr 28 2015
mathematica: max = 50; P[x_] := 1 + Sum[Prime[n]*x^n, {n, 1, max}]; s = Series[1/P[x], {x, 0, max}]; CoefficientList[s, x] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Sep 24 2014 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
